newsitem.title: UK: LPC-Tunisia to get $100 million in 7-year loan.
newsitem.headline: LPC-Tunisia to get $100 million in 7-year loan.

text.p: LONDON, August 22 (LPC) - Arrangers ABC International, Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi, Dresdner Bank Luxembourg, Natwest Markets and Societe Generale today launched syndication of a seven year, $100 million term loan for the Republic of Tunisia, the banks announced.
The fully underwritten transaction, which will be used for general financing purposes, is priced at 50 bps over LIBOR for the first five years, rising to 60 bps thereafter.
The facility will be repaid in equal semi-annual installments after a 60 month grace period from the signing date and must be drawn within three months of signing.
This deal compares favourably with a five-year facility of the same size which the Republic sought in December 1995. That credit was priced 70 bps over LIBOR.
